alert.note: Alert for Clark; Taylor (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 12 at 5:30AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Clark and central Taylor Counties through 615 AM CDT... At 529 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles north of Owen, or 12 miles west of Medford, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Medford around 540 AM CDT. Chelsea around 550 AM CDT. Westboro around 555 AM CDT. Rib Lake around 600 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Wood Lake, North Twin Lake, and The Mondeaux Flowage. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
